raw_text: We point out that one such approach, recently proposed by Pang et al (2003), also represents paraphrases by lattices, similarly to our method, although their lattices are derived using parse information
clean_text: We point out that one such approach, recently proposed by Pang et al (2003), also represents paraphrases by lattices, similarly to our method, although their lattices are derived using parse information.

raw_text: Much prior work has used lattices to compactly represent a range of lexical choices (Pang et al,2003)
clean_text: Much prior work has used lattices to compactly represent a range of lexical choices (Pang et al,2003).

raw_text: Finally, we described and evaluated our first results on sentence realization based on these refined alignments, with promising results. Similar work is described in [Pang et al, 2003], who describe a syntax-based algorithm that builds word lattices from parallel translations which can be used to generate new para phrases
clean_text: Similar work is described in [Pang et al, 2003], who describe a syntax-based algorithm that builds word lattices from parallel translations which can be used to generate new para phrases.

raw_text: In the automatic evaluation of machine translation, paraphrases may help to alleviate problems presented by the fact that there are often alternative and equally valid ways of translating a text (Pang et al, 2003)
clean_text: In the automatic evaluation of machine translation, paraphrases may help to alleviate problems presented by the fact that there are often alternative and equally valid ways of translating a text (Pang et al, 2003).

raw_text: A growing body of recent research has focused on the problems of identifying and generating paraphrases ,e.g., Barzilay& amp; McKeown (2001), Lin& amp; Pantel (2002), Shinyama et al (2002), Barzilay& amp; Lee (2003), and Pang et al (2003)

It seems probable that the effect of the 10K training corpus can be greatly augmented by adding sentence pairs that have been aligned from multiple translations using the techniques described in ,e.g., Barzilay& amp; McKeown (2001) and Pang et al (2003)
(Pang et al, 2003), for example, apply syntactic fusion to multiple translations of individual sentences
Earlier, Barzilay and Lee (2003) and Panget al (2003) developed approaches to aligning multiple reference translations in order to extract para phrases and generate new sentences
clean_text: Earlier, Barzilay and Lee (2003) and Pang et al (2003) developed approaches to aligning multiple reference translations in order to extract para phrases and generate new sentences.
